clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy Study of Islets Xenotransplantation
clinical_study.official_title: Investigation of Safety and Efficacy Study of Islets Xenotransplantation for Patients With Type 1 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: The neonatal pig islets will be used as donor culturing with our modified culture medium. At the same time the autologous T regulatory cells will be used to induce specific immune tolerance for porcine islets grafts combined the costimulation of T cell activation channel blockers. The treatment for type 1 diabetes will be evaluated the efficacy and safety.

primary_outcome.description: Before and after transplantation the patient will be tested the blood glucose. If the blood glucose within 24 hours is stable and no occurrence of diabetic ketoacidosis and hypoglycemia.Thirty percent reduction of exogenous insulin requirement will be considered as effective.

secondary_outcome.description: The patient will be detected the porcine C-peptide levels after transplantion every three months.
After transplantation the patient will be checked hemoglobin A1c every month.The level of HbA1c less than 6.5% was considered as effective.
AST will be tested every three months.
ALT will be tested every three months.
Scr will be tested every three months.
BUN will be tested every three months.
Ultrasonic examination will be used for the recipient's liver before transplantation and every three month post transplantation.
MRI will be used for liver before transplantaion and every three month post transplantation.
The recipient's serum and peripheral blood monouclear cells (PBMC) will be collected for virus detection every six months.
The recipient's peripheral blood monouclear cells (PBMC) and the serum will be collected for immune cell's analysis.
The recipient's peripheral blood monouclear cells (PBMC) and the serum will be collected cytokine beads array (CBA) test.
